content: निर्वाण {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} {@--1@} Blown or put out, extinguished (as a lamp or fire); निर्वाणवैरदहनाः प्रशमादरीणां <ls>Ve. 1. 7</ls>; <ls>Ku. 2. 23.</ls> {@--2@} Lost, disappeared. {@--3@} Dead, deceased. {@--4@} Liberated from existence. {@--5@} Set (as the sun). {@--6@} Calmed, quieted. {@--7@} Plunged. --णं {@--1@} Extinction; <ls>H. 1. 131</ls>; शनैर्निर्वाणमाप्नोति निरिंधन इवानलः <ls>Mb.</ls> {@--2@} Vanishing from sight, disappearance. {@--3@} Dissolution, death. {@--4@} Final liberation or emancipation from matter and reunion with the Supreme Spirit, eternal bliss, निर्वाणमपि मन्येऽहमंतरायं जयश्रियः <ls>Ki. 11. 69</ls>; <ls>R. 12. 1.</ls> {@--5@} (With Buddhists) Absolute extinction or annihilation, complete extinction of individual or worldly existence. {@--6@} Perfect and perpetual calm, repose; <ls>Ki. 18. 39.</ls> {@--7@} Complete satisfaction or pleasure, supreme bliss, highest felicity; अये लब्धं नेत्रनिर्वाणं <ls>Ś. 3</ls>; <ls>M. 3. 1</ls>; <ls>Śi. 4. 23</ls>; <ls>V. 3. 21.</ls> {@--8@} Cessation, desisting. {@--9@} Vacuity. {@--10@} Union, association, confluence. {@--11@} The bathing of an elephant; as in अनिर्वाण at <ls>R. 1. 71.</ls> {@--12@} Instruction in sciences.
